Media

Class SoundPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Media.SoundPlayer

  • public class SoundPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a quick way to put a sound on a form so it can be played. Creates a form with sound Component on it. The sound can be played, and the form will display the length (nuimber of samples) of the sound. A SoundPlayer may only have 1 sound in it.
    Version:
    1.0 July 08, 2.0 (09/05/04)
    Author:
    A. Cheesman, D. Hughes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SoundPlayer()
      Creates a SoundPlayer which can have a Sound placed in it for audio playback.
      SoundPlayer(Sound s)
      Creates a SoundPlayer with a Sound that can be played.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the SoundPlayer and frees resources when the user presses Close.
      Sound getSound()
      Returns the Sound in the SoundPlayer.
      void hide()
      Makes the SoundPlayer invisible, so that it can not be seen on the desktop.
      void placeSound(Sound s)
      Places the Sound object into the sound player on the SoundPlayer.
      void setSound(Sound s)
      Deprecated. 
      use placeSound(Sound s) instead
      void show()
      Makes the SoundPlayer visible, so that it can be seen on the desktop.
      void waitForUser()
      Waits for the user to finish using the SoundPlayer and press OK.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundPlayer

        Creates a SoundPlayer which can have a Sound placed in it for audio playback.

      • SoundPlayer

        public SoundPlayer(Sound s)
        Creates a SoundPlayer with a Sound that can be played.
        Parameters:
        s - the Sound to be played.

    • Method Detail

      • setSound

        public void setSound(Sound s)
        Deprecated. use placeSound(Sound s) instead
        Places the Sound object into the sound player on the SoundPlayer.
        Parameters:
        s - The Sound object to go into the player

      • placeSound

        public void placeSound(Sound s)
        Places the Sound object into the sound player on the SoundPlayer.
        Parameters:
        s - The Sound object to go into the player

      • getSound

        public Sound getSound()
        Returns the Sound in the SoundPlayer.
        Returns:
        the Sound in the sound player

      • show

        public void show()
        Makes the SoundPlayer visible, so that it can be seen on the desktop.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Makes the SoundPlayer invisible, so that it can not be seen on the desktop.

      • waitForUser

        public void waitForUser()
        Waits for the user to finish using the SoundPlayer and press OK.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the SoundPlayer and frees resources when the user presses Close. The SoundPlayer should not be used thereafter.
